isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - FULLER 10 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS - INSTALL - UPPER COUNTERSHAFT BEARING

step1.para: Make sure the lower countershaft and main drive gear timing marks are aligned.
Mesh the marked tooth of the upper countershaft with the two remaining marked teeth of the main drive gear.
Support and center the front of the countrshaft by placing a support tool in the front bore as shown ( Figure 146).

figure.caption: Figure 146. Place Support Tool in Front Bore

step1.para: Place a large screwdriver or prybar at the front of the countershaft between the case wall and countershaft to space the countershaft rearward approximately 6 mm (1/4 inch) ( Figure 147).
Place a bearing over the rear of the countershaft. It doesn't matter which bearing is chosen. The front and rear bearings are identical.

caution.para: The bearing driver must bear on both the inner and outer race of the bearing. If the bearing driver contacts only one race, the bearing will be damaged.

step1.para: Place a flanged-end bearing driver over the countershaft rear bearing, and drive the bearing into the case bore. The countershaft may need to be lifted slightly to start the bearing into the bore. When the bearing is fully seated, no gap should be visible between the bearing and the shaft ( Figure 148, left). If the bearing is not fully seated, the snap ring to be installed at Step 7 will not fit ( Figure 148, right).

figure.caption: Figure 148. Bearing Fully Seated, No Gap (Left), and Bearing Not Fully Seated (Right)

step1.para: In the countershaft rear groove, install the rear snap ring.
If necessary, tap the countershaft forward to seat the rear bearing in its bore.
Install the mainshaft rear bearing retainer. Apply Loctite 242 or equivalent to the bolts, and tighten the bolts to 54 to 61 Nm (40 to 45 ft-lbs) ( Figure 149).
Remove the timing block and place the remaining bearing on the front of the countershaft.
Place a flanged-end bearing driver over the bearing, and drive the bearing over the countershaft until the inner race is flush with the end of the countershaft ( Figure 150).

figure.caption: Figure 149. Install Mainshaft Rear Bearing Retainer
